name: Kenya Collins
about: The Nikon Z9 has impressed us with its speed and autofocus but what's the image quality like? We found there's very little penalty to be paid for the other capabilities the stacked CMOS sensor brings.

name: Dolly Parrish
about: Professional sports photographer Mark Pain has been using a Nikon Z9 for some time, inside some of the biggest venues in the UK. We caught up with him recently to get his opinion and insights into Nikon's most important pro camera for at least a decade.

name: Penelope Yang
about: After two rounds of voting, DPReview readers have decided on their favorite product (and runners-up) of 2021. Find out which cameras and lenses topped the list!

name: Wong Hudson
about: Curious to test the Z9 high pixel count sensor in a low light fast action sports environment vs a D6. My 850 couldn't do it while my D6 did a good job. Keeping the noise down with the Z9 in that environment will be a major problem IMO. But lets wait and see.

name: Knapp Emerson
about: There are many similarities between the Canon R5 and the Nikon Z9 in terms of specifications, which may seem odd, but it should be remembered that the R5 was introduced a year ago.

name: Hendrix Gallegos
about: Maybe better to ask: Does the Z9 fulfills (specific) tasks which other Nikon camera's can't do? In relation to this part of the market the camera is aimed at, you don't ask that question to yourself (will it make me a better photographer).

name: Valencia Walker
about: I've often critciized Nikon (...mostly for its policy 'bout many issues w/ various models) but this time I think they have really nailed it w/ this Z9... it's a camera that makes you want to buy it. Congratulation, Nikon!

name: Hall Sims
about: I think I am finally ready to upgrade from my Nikon D700, though I do not plan to get rid of it, it will become my backup. I still love the shots I get with the D700, it retains a film like quality IMO, but excited to finally upgrade. Big jump for me.

name: April Dean
about: I haven't experienced that yet. Nikon Z9 found itself among the main news on the leading Czech news server. Let me remind you that the server never targeted articles according to cookies. Fans are everywhere... ;)
